snippet: The anger being vented by governments in Europe over spying by the United States may be feigned, but the concerns about privacy are real.
abstract: Editorial questions authenticity of outrage expressed by European governments over report that National Security Agency has been spying on their diplomatic offices; contends one good result from disclosures about spying is that it might reinforce European demands for tighter rules on data collection of private individuals by companies and governments.
lead_paragraph: The anger being vented by governments in Europe over spying by the United States may be feigned, but the concerns about privacy are real.
